issues.title: Missing Collective Bargaining Agreement Requirement
issues.description: California law requires that peer assistance and review programs be established through collective bargaining agreements with the exclusive representative of certificated employees. Neither the policy nor regulation acknowledges this fundamental legal requirement for program establishment.

legal_citations.text: "A school district may establish a peer assistance and review program for certificated employees pursuant to a collective bargaining agreement with the exclusive representative of certificated employees in the district."

issues.required_language: The peer assistance and review program shall be established pursuant to a collective bargaining agreement with the exclusive representative of certificated employees in the district, in accordance with Education Code Section 44500.

issues.title: Missing Due Process and Appeal Rights
issues.description: The policy and regulation fail to address due process protections and appeal rights for participating teachers, which are essential components required by law to protect employee rights in peer review programs.

legal_citations.text: Peer assistance and review programs must include "due process protections for participating teachers, including the right to appeal decisions of the review panel."

issues.required_language: The program shall include due process protections for participating teachers, including the right to appeal decisions of the review panel through established grievance procedures.

issues.title: Missing Confidentiality Requirements
issues.description: Neither document addresses the confidentiality requirements for peer assistance and review proceedings, which are mandated by law to protect participating teachers and maintain program integrity.

legal_citations.text: "All proceedings of the peer review panel shall be confidential. Information obtained through the peer assistance and review process shall not be used in any disciplinary action against a participating teacher."

issues.required_language: All proceedings of the peer review panel shall be confidential. Information obtained through the peer assistance and review process shall not be used in any disciplinary action against a participating teacher, except as specifically provided by law.

issues.title: Missing Consulting Teacher Release Time and Compensation
issues.description: The regulation does not address the required provisions for consulting teacher release time and compensation, which are mandatory elements under California law for peer assistance and review programs.

legal_citations.text: "Consulting teachers shall be provided with adequate release time to perform their duties and shall receive appropriate compensation for their services as specified in the collective bargaining agreement."

issues.required_language: Consulting teachers shall be provided with adequate release time to perform their duties and shall receive appropriate compensation for their services as specified in the collective bargaining agreement.

issues.title: Missing Program Duration Specifications
issues.description: The regulation does not specify the duration of participation in the peer assistance and review program, which should be clearly defined to ensure consistent implementation and participant understanding.

legal_citations.text: Programs should specify "the duration of participation in the program, which shall not exceed two school years unless extended by mutual agreement."

issues.required_language: The duration of participation in the peer assistance and review program shall not exceed two school years unless extended by mutual agreement between the district and the participating teacher.
